tournament.name: Pro Tour Magic Battle for Zendikar (Milwaukee)

decks.notes: The main focus of this Abzan Aggro deck is to apply pressure on the opponent with a combination of efficient creatures and powerful spells. By playing cards like Anafenza, the Foremost, Siege Rhino, and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, the deck aims to deal damage quickly and effectively. The inclusion of cards like Den Protector and Hangarback Walker allows for resilience and card advantage. With a mix of removal, pump spells, and threats, the deck looks to finish the game fast while maintaining a strong board presence.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly apply pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Mantis Rider and Seeker of the Way, while using versatile spells like Fiery Impulse and Jeskai Charm to control the board. Cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Valorous Stance provide additional support and protection for your creatures. The deck also includes ways to draw cards, such as Treasure Cruise, to maintain card advantage and keep up the pressure. Mana fixing lands like Mystic Monastery and Prairie Stream ensure you can cast your spells efficiently.

The key idea behind this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells. By efficiently controlling the board with removal spells like Murderous Cut and Dromoka's Command, while also deploying threats like Siege Rhino and Hangarback Walker, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of versatile cards like Den Protector and Abzan Charm allows for adaptability in different situations, ensuring a strong and competitive performance in Standard 1 vs 1 matches.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful creatures and control spells. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans and maintaining board presence. The creatures like Mantis Rider and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker provide aggressive threats while Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Tasigur, the Golden Fang give card advantage and graveyard recursion. The control spells like Crackling Doom, Ojutai's Command, and Dispel help disrupt the opponent's plays and protect your own creatures. The deck also utilizes fetch lands and multicolor lands to ensure consistent mana base.

This aggressive deck focuses on quickly building a board presence with cheap creatures like Monastery Swiftspear, Zurgo Bellstriker, and Abbot of Keral Keep, while using spells like Titan's Strength and Become Immense to pump them up and deal massive damage to the opponent. Burn spells like Wild Slash and Atarka's Command can help clear the way or finish off the opponent. The deck aims to win as quickly as possible by overwhelming the opponent with a combination of creatures and direct damage spells.

The primary focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and powerful creatures. It aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage through spells like Dig Through Time and Ojutai's Command. The deck also includes aggressive creatures like Mantis Rider and Sarkhan, the Dragonspeaker to provide a clock for winning the game. Overall, it is a versatile deck that can adapt to different situations and outlast opponents through resource management and efficient card choices.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly flood the board with tokens generated from cards like Dragon Fodder and Hordeling Outburst, while using spells like Jeskai Charm and Jeskai Ascendancy to pump them up and push for early aggressive attacks. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy provide additional support and card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells such as Wild Slash and Silkwrap to control the board. The mana base is built around the Jeskai color combination to ensure consistency in casting spells.

The deck focuses on aggressive plays with a combination of powerful creatures such as Deathmist Raptor, Hangarback Walker, and Warden of the First Tree, supported by removal spells like Dromoka's Command and Silkwrap. The deck also utilizes cards like Den Protector and Nissa, Vastwood Seer to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. The inclusion of Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Wingmate Roc adds additional threats to pressure the opponent. The mana base is optimized with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure smooth mana curve and consistent performance.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells to generate a fast-paced aggressive strategy. The deck includes a mix of efficient creatures such as Hangarback Walker, Warden of the First Tree, and Wingmate Roc, combined with removal spells like Stasis Snare and Dromoka's Command to maintain board control. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Den Protector and Deathmist Raptor for card advantage and flexibility. By establishing board presence early and putting pressure on the opponent, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats from the board, and drawing into powerful cards. It utilizes counterspells like Silumgar's Scorn and Clash of Wills to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also having removal spells like Utter End and Ruinous Path to deal with any threats that do make it onto the battlefield. The deck also includes powerful dragons like Dragonlord Ojutai and Dragonlord Silumgar to finish off the opponent once the game is under control. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistent access to all colors needed for the deck's spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive early game plays and quick damage output. It utilizes low-cost creatures and spells to quickly build up board presence and deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes powerful pump spells like Become Immense and Titan's Strength to enhance the damage output of its creatures. With a strong mana base and a mix of creature types, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize, securing a fast victory through aggressive gameplay.

This deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources while maintaining a strong presence with powerful creatures like Anafenza, the Foremost and Siege Rhino. It utilizes a variety of removal spells and versatile cards like Abzan Charm and Bring to Light to handle different situations. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and ensure consistent access to all the spells. Overall, the deck aims to dictate the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent through efficient removal and resilient threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful creatures like Siege Rhino, Nissa, and Jace. Utilizing a mix of board wipes like Languish and Crux of Fate, along with versatile spells like Bring to Light and Abzan Charm, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while establishing its own board presence. The mana base is designed to support the deck's multicolor requirements, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a win through incremental advantage.

This deck aims to control the board with a mix of powerful spells and creatures, using removal spells like Draconic Roar and Crackling Doom to deal with threats while playing creatures like Thunderbreak Regent and Mantis Rider to apply pressure. Cards like Ojutai's Command and Dig Through Time help maintain card advantage and flexibility in different situations. The deck's mana base allows for consistent color fixing to ensure spells can be cast on curve. Overall, the deck aims to establish board dominance and outvalue the opponent in the mid to late game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and counterspells while generating card advantage through card draw effects. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and stabilizing the board with cards like Duress, Languish, and Ruinous Path. By efficiently answering threats and drawing cards with Painful Truths and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and ultimately win the game with powerful planeswalkers like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Ob Nixilis Reignited.

The main idea behind this Gruul Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures, utilizing pump spells and combat tricks to deal massive damage quickly. The deck focuses on deploying efficient threats like Monastery Swiftspear and Den Protector early on, and then using cards like Titan's Strength, Become Immense, and Temur Battle Rage to boost their power and finish off the opponent in a swift manner. Atarka's Command provides additional reach and versatility, while the land base ensures consistent mana production for the deck's fast-paced game plan.

This deck focuses on creating a fast and aggressive board presence using powerful creatures like Mantis Rider and Jace, Vryn's Prodigy. It also includes strong support cards like Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Jeskai Charm to maintain pressure on the opponent. The deck also contains a suite of removal spells like Roast and Fiery Impulse to deal with threats efficiently. Additionally, the inclusion of Dig Through Time helps to provide card advantage and ensure consistency in drawing key cards. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and ensure smooth gameplay.

This deck focuses on using powerful planeswalkers like Gideon and Sarkhan, alongside removal spells like Crackling Doom and Utter End, to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. Hangarback Walker and Pia and Kiran Nalaar provide additional threats and value generation. The deck aims to maintain board control and outvalue the opponent through a combination of removal, threats, and planeswalker abilities. The mana base is designed to support the three-color combination of Mardu while also providing a mix of colored sources for the spells in the deck.

The main concept of this deck is to establish control over the game by using removal spells like Silkwrap and Stasis Snare to deal with threats, while also generating value with cards like Retreat to Emeria and Nissa, Vastwood Seer. The deck aims to stabilize the board with powerful threats like Wingmate Roc and Gideon, Ally of Zendikar, while also having the ability to go wide with Secure the Wastes. The mana base is optimized for consistency and allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent to secure the win.

The main concept of this Bant Control deck is to maintain board control and tempo through a combination of removal spells, token generation, and powerful planeswalkers. By using cards like Silkwrap, Stasis Snare, and Planar Outburst to remove threats from the opponent's side of the battlefield, while also generating tokens with Gideon, Ally of Zendikar and Secure the Wastes, this deck aims to create a favorable board state and eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Wingmate Roc and Hangarback Walker. Additionally, the deck includes card draw with Elvish Visionary and Nissa, Vastwood Seer to ensure consistency and longevity in the game.

The main focus of this deck is to establish board control and create card advantage through a combination of powerful planeswalkers like Gideon and Nissa, alongside versatile removal spells like Silkwrap and Stasis Snare. Utilizing creatures like Hangarback Walker and Wingmate Roc to apply pressure on the opponent while also having the ability to generate tokens with Secure the Wastes. The deck also includes counterspells like Dispel for protection and finishers like Retreat to Emeria to close out games efficiently. This deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents in a grindy control matchup.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on aggressive plays and quick damage output. It includes powerful creatures like Thunderbreak Regent and Kolaghan, the Storm's Fury, as well as removal spells like Draconic Roar and Ruinous Path to help control the board. The inclusion of Ob Nixilis Reignited adds card advantage and removal, while the land base supports the deck's color requirements for consistent plays. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early on and maintain momentum to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main focus of this Selesnya Aggro deck is to quickly establish a board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures like Hangarback Walker, Den Protector, and Avatar of the Resolute, combined with removal spells like Stasis Snare and Valorous Stance, the deck aims to control the battlefield and deal damage efficiently. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar provides additional tokens for aggression, while Nissa, Vastwood Seer helps with card advantage. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and mana ramp.
